obstacles.name: G-Mode Grab Item and Leave Before Exiting G-Mode

farmCycles.name: Zoa Power Beam spam
farmCycles.note: Needs Gravity to get into the sand

farmCycles.name: Zoa Power Beam suitless back and forth

to.devNote: There's nothing difficult about getting here suitless, but it does run a heavy risk of leading the player into suitless Maridia situations.
There's nothing difficult about getting here suitless, but it does run a heavy risk of leading the player into suitless Maridia situations.
Direct link passing below. Passage above should go 1 -> 5 -> 4.
Direct link passing below. Passage above should go 4 -> 6 -> 5 -> 1.

strats.name: Leave Spinning (Across Room)
strats.note: Use Speed Booster to break the Speed blocks, and run from the right side of the room, using blue speed to run on top of the sand.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball (Across Room)
strats.note: Use Speed Booster to break the Speed blocks, and run from the right side of the room, using blue speed to run on top of the sand.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Across Room)
strats.note: Use Speed Booster to break the Speed blocks, and run from the right side of the room, using blue speed to run on top of the sand.

strats.name: Leave Space Jumping (Across Room)
strats.note: Use Speed Booster to break the Speed blocks, and run from the right side of the room, using blue speed to run on top of the sand.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Puyo
Leave with Runway Through the Speed Blocks
Speed Blocks Already Broken Suitless
devNote: Gravity can run across the sand with speed again.
FIXME: This is possible without HiJump by breaking spin before landing, then quickly jumping again. Useful in other places as well, like Aqueduct.

strats.name: Speedball (Come in Getting Blue Speed)
note: Enter the room with blue speed, and jump into a speedball.

strats.name: Speedball (Come in Blue Spinning)
note: Enter the room in a spin jump with blue speed, and enter a speedball.

strats.name: Speedball, Leave With Temporary Blue (Come in Getting Blue Speed)
note: Enter the room with blue speed, and jump into a speedball.
Then chain temporary blue into the next room.

strats.name: Speedball, Leave With Temporary Blue (Come in Blue Spinning)
note: Enter the room in a spin jump with blue speed, and enter a speedball.
Then chain temporary blue into the next room.

strats.name: Blue Spring Ball Bounce
note: Bounce through the Speed blocks.
devNote: With a mid-air spring ball jump it would be possible to go through the morph tunnel.
This strat exists mainly as a way to avoid collecting the item.

strats.name: Blue Spring Ball Bounce, Leave With Temporary Blue
note: Bounce through the Speed blocks.
Then unmorph and chain temporary blue into the next room.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: Overload PLMs by touching the sand, then move through the speed blocks. Avoiding the sand pits is easier without Gravity or HiJump.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
note: Needs near max horizontal speed coming from about 40 runway tiles in the adjacent room.
Jump after the transition.
Running a longer on the short runway is more difficult at maximum speed, but will increase the success of the jump.
A crisp momentum conserving morph can also make up for a jump that is buffered through the door.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster, Spring Ball
note: Needs a runway of 7 tiles with no open end in the adjacent room, to get enough height. This is a peak of height with speed booster, no hjb, while underwater.
Jump before the transition with SpeedBooster off and then SpeedBooster back on after reaching the ceiling and Morphing.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Direct
strats.note: Be careful not to touch or bomb the sand in order to grab the item before PLMs are overloaded.

strats.name: Botwoon Energy Tank Room Puyo Bomb-Grapple-Jump
note: Lure a Puyo close to the sand and use it to Bomb-Grapple-Jump up to the Morph Ball maze.
It helps to predict the jump pattern of the enemy.

strats.name: Botwoon Energy Tank Room Sand Grapple Boost
note: Lure a Puyo close to the sand to use for a Sand Grapple Boost.
As it is close to entering the sand, land on the sand and crouch.
Very quickly after crouching shoot the grapple and jump.
As soon as the Puyo is killed aim down to escape the sand.
If the timings don't work out just right, too much height is lost to the sand.
Crouching in sand is also a high softlock risk.

strats.name: Sand Bomb Boost
note: Stand on the edge of the sand and place a Bomb and wait briefly before entering the sand.
Let the Bomb explosion push Samus up for a few frames before simultaneously jumping and aiming down.
There is about a 2 frame window before too much height is lost to reach the nearby ledge.
Jumping too early can lead to a softlock but jumping too late usually exits the sand safely.

strats.name: Speed Blocks Already Broken With Gravity
Suitless Shinespark
strats.note: Coming in with zero momentum, all it takes is one non-HiJump full height jump forward, then activate.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge, Blue Speed Run
devNote: This is just a rough estimate of the minimum number of tiles that this runway can represent.
It is designed for a skill level that won't be able to use canStutterWaterShineCharge.

strats.name: Suitless Stutter Water Shinecharge, Leave With Temporary Blue
Speedball
note: This is just a rough estimate of the minimum number of tiles that this runway can represent.

strats.name: Speedball, Leave With Temporary Blue
note: This is just a rough estimate of the minimum number of tiles that this runway can represent.

strats.name: Blue Spring Ball Bounce
note: Bounce through the Speed blocks.
devNote: With a mid-air spring ball jump it would be possible to go through the morph tunnel.
This strat exists mainly as a way to avoid collecting the item.

strats.name: Blue Spring Ball Bounce, Leave With Temporary Blue
note: Bounce through the Speed blocks.
Then unmorph and chain temporary blue into the next room.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
note: Overload PLMs by touching the sand, then move through the speed blocks.
Shoot the Puyo while crouching to increase accuracy.
Avoiding the right pit is much easier without Gravity or HiJump.
Standing on the edge and spin jumping to the left is much easier than a running jump.
While on the left side of this platform, the Puyo to the left will start moving; carefully kill it.

strats.name: G-Mode
note: Overload PLMs by touching the sand, then move through the speed blocks.
Shoot the Puyo while crouching to increase accuracy.
Avoiding the right pit is much easier without Gravity or HiJump.
Standing on the edge and spin jumping to the left is much easier than a running jump.
While on the left side of this platform, the Puyo to the left will start moving; carefully kill or dodge it.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: With Gravity, or Spring Ball and HiJump, it is easiest to go through the Morph maze at the top of the room and fall into the the sand.
Otherwise, the overload PLMs by touching the sand, or by bombing the speed blocks, to be able to go through to the left.
Killing the Zoas with Bombs or Power Bombs will prevent them from respawning, although it is possible but tricky to dodge them with just Spring Ball.

strats.name: G-Mode
note: Overload PLMs by touching the sand, then move through the speed blocks.
Shoot the Puyo while crouching to increase accuracy.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: With Gravity, or Spring Ball and HiJump, it is easiest to go through the Morph maze at the top of the room and fall into the the sand.
Otherwise, the overload PLMs by touching the sand, or by bombing the speed blocks, to be able to go through to the left.
Killing the Zoas with Bombs or Power Bombs will prevent them from respawning, although it is possible but tricky to dodge them with just Spring Ball.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zoa
note: Lure the Zoas. Jump so that they start moving horizontally while higher, use spin jumps to move horizontally faster while keeping them on screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Direct
note: Be careful not to touch or bomb the sand in order to grab the item before PLMs are overloaded.
With bombs, kill the Zoas and they will stop spawning.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
strats.note: With bombs, kill the Zoas and they will stop spawning.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge
strats.note: Shinespark diagonally over the zoa pit or run through the speed blocks and shinespark after turning around.
devNote: This is just a rough estimate of the minimum number of tiles that this runway can represent.
It is designed for a skill level that won't be able to use canStutterWaterShineCharge.

strats.name: Suitless Stutter Water Shinecharge
strats.note: Shinespark diagonally over the zoa pit or run through the speed blocks and shinespark after turning around.

strats.name: Speedy Jump
note: If using at least 8 tiles of runway, jump before going down the first slope.
If using 7 tiles of runway, Samus will get a higher jump; in this case, jump later, after going down the first slope
devNote: We don't require 'canTrickyDashJump' here, since any speed of at least $2.0 works;
a different jump timing is needed for run speed between $2.0 and $2.3 compared to higher speeds,
but there is a very large window in both cases, making it not difficult for the player to find a timing that works.

strats.name: Cross Room Space Jump Airball
devNote: With high enough speed this could be done without morphing, but it would be more difficult, and Morph is needed to get through the maze anyway.

strats.name: Bomb Grapple Jump
strats.note: Use the respawning Zoas to double jump up to the Morph Ball maze.

strats.name: Sand Grapple Boost
note: Use the respawning Zoas as a grapple target to get a sand boost in order to reach the ledge above.
Shoot Grapple just after landing on the sand.
Jump as soon as the Zoa is hit, and aim down to escape the sand.
Avoid getting hit by killing the extra Zoas since falling into the sand is a softlock.

strats.name: Sand Bomb Boost
note: Kill all of the enemies and leave drops uncollected so that the Zoas will not be in the way.
Stand on the edge of the sand and place a Bomb and wait briefly before entering the sand.
Let the Bomb explosion push Samus up for a few frames before simultaneously jumping and aiming down.
Then move left to land on the Morph tunnel ledge.
Jumping too early can lead to a softlock but jumping too late usually exits the sand safely.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: If the Puyos are alive, lure the first to the right, then roll out of the hole, unmorph and fight them. Crouching while shooting may increase accuracy.
strats.devNote: FIXME This probably shouldnt be free if the Puyos are still alive.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Exit Tunnel Before Leaving G-Mode
strats.note: If the Puyos are alive, lure the first to the right, then roll out of the hole, unmorph and fight them. Crouching while shooting may increase accuracy.
strats.devNote: FIXME This probably shouldnt be free if the Puyos are still alive.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Exit Tunnel Before Leaving G-Mode
Suitless Bootless Mid-Air Morph
strats.note: Jump and mid-air morph. This is much easier with Gravity and HiJump turned off.

strats.name: Suitless Bootless Mid-Air Morph
strats.note: Jump and mid-air morph. This is much easier with Gravity and HiJump turned off.
